message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Living Standards Measurement Study, we find that export participation is associated with higher wages in the manufacturing sector.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Living Standards Measurement Study"], "topic": ["Trade", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on data from the Demographic and Health Survey conducted in India to examine the relationship between maternal education and child nutritional status.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Education"]}, {"sentence": "We use satellite imagery data from the Landsat program to estimate the extent of forest cover loss in a selected region of the Brazilian Amazon rainforest.", "dataset": ["Landsat program"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We employ data from the UNESCO Institute for Statistics to investigate trends in literacy rates among women in low-income countries over the past decade.", "dataset": ["UNESCO Institute for Statistics"], "topic": ["Gender", "Education"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey and the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System to assess the prevalence of diabetes among adults in rural areas of the United States.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey", "Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the relationship between economic growth and carbon emissions using both country-level and subnational-level data from the World Bank's Urbanization Reviews and the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change's Fifth Assessment Report.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Urbanization Reviews", "Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change's Fifth Assessment Report"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This analysis makes use of two datasets: the World Values Survey and the Afrobarometer, both of which provide information on citizens' attitudes towards democracy and governance in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Governance", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health with data from the American Time Use Survey to investigate the relationship between physical activity and mental health outcomes among young adults in the United States.", "dataset": ["National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health", "American Time Use Survey"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses data from the Labor Force Survey and the Household Income and Expenditure Survey to examine the extent and nature of income inequality in urban areas of the Philippines.", "dataset": ["Labor Force Survey", "Household Income and Expenditure Survey"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the World Bank's Doing Business report along with data on cross-national differences in cultural values from the GLOBE project to investigate the determinants of entrepreneurship across countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Doing Business report", "GLOBE project"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Living Standards Measurement Study, we find that export participation is associated with higher wages in the manufacturing sector.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Living Standards Measurement Study"], "topic": ["Trade", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on data from the
